Detailed Description

Class defining different window types as static methods.

Windows are cached with window type combined with its length as a key. It is an efficient way to reduce calls to math functions.

Definition at line 39 of file Window.h.

Member Function Documentation

double Aquila::Window::apply ( WindowType  type,
unsigned int  n,
unsigned int  N 
) [static]

Returns window value for a given window type, size and position.

Window is first looked up in cache. If it doesn't exist, it is generated. The cached value is then returned.

Parameters:
type window function type
n sample position in the window
N window length
Returns:
window value for n-th sample
